scenarioDescription:
The HD 8574 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 8574 is a star with 1.34 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.38 times its radius. It is located 146.20 light years away from the solar system.

HD 8574 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 8574 system


HD 8574 b

HD 8574 b was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory observatory, in 2003-11, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.76 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 8574 b is 645.540 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 8574 b is 13.400 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 8574 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 8574, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Haute-Provence Observatory.
name: HD 8574 - System With 1 Exoplanet
